title: Paikuli
description: At Paikuli, located in what is now the southern part of Iraqi Kurdistan near the modern-day village of Barkal, Sulaymaniyah Governorate, Iraq, are the remains of a stone masonry tower that was erected as a monument to a victory enjoyed by the Sasanian emperor Narseh over his grandnephew. The inscription is now housed in the Sulaymaniyah Museum.

properties.description: Point representing the location of the tower and inscription at Paikuli, derived from an OpenStreetMap Node.
properties.title: OSM location of Paykuli
